title: LysR transcriptional regulator detector
description: This feature detects a highly conserved sequence element associated with LysR-type transcriptional regulator genes across diverse bacterial phyla. The activation consistently shows a strong, sharp spike pattern either directly at or immediately adjacent to LysR family transcription factor annotations. LysR regulators are the most abundant type of transcription factors in prokaryotes, controlling diverse metabolic processes including aromatic compound catabolism, amino acid biosynthesis, and stress responses. The feature likely recognizes a conserved DNA-binding domain or structural motif characteristic of this regulator family. The pattern is remarkably consistent across taxonomically diverse organisms including proteobacteria (α, β, γ), spirochetes, and gram-positive bacteria, indicating its importance in bacterial genome function and regulation.
